summary: Linguistic discrimination refers to the unjust treatment of individuals based on their language or dialect, infringing upon their rights and freedoms as enshrined in EU legal frameworks. This concept is pivotal in ensuring that all citizens can participate fully in societal and institutional contexts, free from bias or exclusion due to linguistic diversity. The EU promotes linguistic equality through various regulations and directives, emphasizing the importance of cultural and linguistic rights. By addressing linguistic discrimination, the EU aims to foster inclusivity and uphold the principles of equality and non-discrimination, thereby reinforcing the fundamental rights of all individuals within its jurisdiction.
